applicability_reasoning: This regulation applies to the pension life cover scheme document for several reasons: 1) The document is from AIB life, which is explicitly stated to be regulated by the Central Bank of Ireland, making it a regulated entity subject to these regulations. 2) The document deals with pension and life cover products provided to consumers who are natural persons. 3) The scheme involves trustees and beneficiaries who may be in vulnerable circumstances, particularly in cases of death claims where dependants need to interact with the scheme. 4) The document includes sections about contacting AIB life and providing assistance to scheme members and beneficiaries, which aligns with the regulation's requirement to provide reasonable assistance. 5) Section 3.1 specifically mentions that 'dependants will be required to provide any evidence and information the trustee may require,' which could involve vulnerable individuals needing assistance during the claims process. The document should therefore incorporate processes to assist vulnerable consumers in accordance with this regulation.
regulation_title: Consumers in vulnerable circumstances to be assisted
regulation_text: 34. (1) Where a regulated entity has identified that a consumer that is a natural person is in vulnerable circumstances, the regulated entity shall provide that consumer with such ongoing reasonable assistance as may be necessary to facilitate that consumer in their dealings with the regulated entity. (2) A regulated entity shall ensure that any information received from a consumer in vulnerable circumstances and maintained as a record by the regulated entity is, where appropriate and in accordance with the law, accessible to the staff of the regulated enti ty in the course of the provision by those staff of ongoing reasonable assistance to the consumer.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
